Description: Instrumentation Design: Designing and developing instruments and control systems that can measure, control, and automate industrial processes.Equipment Selection: Selecting the most appropriate instruments and control systems for specific industrial processes based on their performance and cost.Installation: Installing and configuring instruments and control systems, ensuring they are properly calibrated and integrated with existing equipment.Testing and Calibration: Conducting tests and calibrating instruments to ensure their accuracy and reliability.Maintenance: Maintaining and repairing instruments and control systems to ensure they operate efficiently and effectively.Documentation: Creating and maintaining documentation such as user manuals, technical specifications, and installation procedures.Troubleshooting: Troubleshooting issues with instruments and control systems, identifying the root cause of the problem and implementing solutions.
